I2S HAL¶

API Reference¶

group DEVICE_HAL_I2S_DEVSTRUCT

Definitions for I2S device structure.

This structure will be used in user implemented code, which was called Device Driver Implement Layer for I2S to realize in user code.

Defines

DEV_I2S_INFO_SET_EXTRA_OBJECT(i2s_info_ptr, extra_info)¶

Set extra information pointer of I2S

DEV_I2S_INFO_GET_EXTRA_OBJECT(i2s_info_ptr)¶

Get extra information pointer of I2S

Typedefs

typedef struct DEV_I2S_INFO *DEV_I2S_INFO_PTR¶
typedef struct DEV_I2S *DEV_I2S_PTR¶

Variables

int32_t *i2s_open¶

open I2S device in master/slave mode, \ when in master mode, param stands for speed mode, \ when in slave mode, param stands for slave address

Open an I2S device with selected mode (master or slave) with defined param

Parameters

  • [in] mode: Working mode (master or slave)

  • [in] param: Device type (transmitter OR receiver)

Return Value

  • E_OK: Open successfully without any issues

  • E_OPNED: Device was opened before

  • E_OBJ: Device object is not valid

  • E_SYS: Device initialized parameters are different with parameters in IP

  • E_PAR: Parameter is not valid

  • E_NOSPT: Open settings are not supported

int32_t *i2s_close¶

close I2S device

close an I2S device, just decrease the opn_cnt, if opn_cnt equals 0, then close the device

Return Value

  • E_OK: Close successfully without any issues(including scenario that device is already closed)

  • E_OPNED: Device is still opened, the device opn_cnt decreased by 1

  • E_OBJ: Device object is not valid

int32_t *i2s_control¶

control i2s device

Control an I2S device by ctrl_cmd, with passed param. you can control I2S device using predefined I2S control commands defined using DEV_SET_SYSCMD (which must be implemented by bsp developer), command details. And you can also control I2S device using your own specified commands defined using DEV_SET_USRCMD, but these specified commands should be defined in your own I2S device driver implementation.

Parameters

  • [in] ctrl_cmd: control command, to change or get some thing related to I2S

  • [inout] param: Parameters that maybe argument of the command, or return values of the command, must not be NULL

Return Value

  • E_OK: Control device successfully

  • E_CLSED: Device is not opened

  • E_OBJ: Device object is not valid or not exists

  • E_PAR: Parameter is not valid for current control command

  • E_SYS: Control device failed, due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled

  • E_CTX: Control device failed, due to different reasons like in transfer state

  • E_NOSPT: Control command is not supported or not valid

int32_t *i2s_write¶

send data by i2s TX device (blocking method)

Send data through I2S with defined len to RX device.

Parameters

  • [in] data: Pointer to data need to send by I2S

  • [in] len: Length of data to be sent

Return Value

  • >: 0 Byte count that was successfully sent for poll method, it might can’t send that much due to different error state.

  • E_OBJ: Device object is not valid or not exists

  • E_PAR: Parameter is not valid

  • E_CTX: Device is still in transfer state

  • E_SYS: Can’t write data to hardware due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled

int32_t *i2s_read¶

read data from i2s RX device (blocking method)

Receive data of defined len through I2S from TX device.

Parameters

  • [out] data: Pointer to data need to received by I2S

  • [in] len: Length of data to be received

Return Value

  • >: 0 Byte count that was successfully received for poll method, it might can’t send that much due to different error state.

  • E_OBJ: Device object is not valid or not exists

  • E_CTX: Device is still in transfer state

  • E_PAR: Parameter is not valid

  • E_SYS: Can’t receive data from hardware due to hardware issues, such as device is disabled

struct DEV_I2S_INFO¶
#include <dev_i2s.h>

I2S information struct definition.

Informations about I2S open state, working state, baurate, I2S registers, working method, interrupt number

struct DEV_I2S¶
#include <dev_i2s.h>

Definition for I2S device interface.

Define I2S device interface, like I2S information structure, fuctions to get I2S info, open/close/control I2S, send/receive data by I2S

Note

All this details are implemented by user in user porting code
